title: Value of definite integral from derivative graph

content.question: If g is the function defined by <math> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </math>, what is the value of <math> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>⋅</mo> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math>?

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
